subject: The CNN Political Ticker PM, Monday, May 28, 2007
body:
CNN.com - CNN Political Ticker










For the latest, breaking political news, check for updates
throughout the day on the CNN Political Ticker
http://www.cnn.com/ticker All politics, all the
time.

***

Bush observes Memorial Day
at Arlington National Cemetery

WASHINGTON
(CNN) -- President Bush visited Arlington National Cemetery
Monday to observe Memorial Day.

"Today we honor the
warriors who fought our nation's enemies, defended the cause of
liberty, and gave their lives in the cause of freedom," Bush
said. "We offer our love and our heartfelt compassion to the
families who mourn them. We pray that our country may always
prove worthy of the sacrifices they made."

Bush's full
speech:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/bush-observes-memorial-day-at-arlington.html

***

Obama reiterates support for
troops

LITTLETON, New Hampshire (CNN) -- Sen.
Barack Obama joined a handful of war veterans Monday morning at
a small downtown park where he laid a wreath to observe
Memorial Day and brushed off criticism about his opposition to
the Iraq war.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/obama-reiterates-support-for-troops.html

***

Biden spends Memorial Day in Iowa

WATERLOO, IOWA (CNN) -- Keeping a brisk pace under an
75 degree sun, Sen. Joe Biden took to the streets to press the
flesh in Waterloo, Iowa's Memorial Day parade.

Full
story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/biden-spends-memorial-day-in-iowa.html

***

Presidential hopefuls get some bang from early
TV ads

WASHINGTON (AP) -- Using humor,
attitude and the occasional put-down, some presidential
candidates are filling the airwaves with ads to stir activists
and create an early, positive brand for their campaign.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/presidential-hopefuls-get-some-bang.html

***

10 Republicans on stage but room for more,
Huckabee says

WASHINGTON (AP) -- Are 10
Republican presidential contenders enough? One of them, former
Arkansas Gov. Mike Huckabee, said Sunday there is room for
more. Huckabee commented when asked in a broadcast interview
how he felt about the possibility that Fred Thompson, the actor
and former Tennessee senator, might enter the 2008 race.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/10-republicans-on-stage-but-room-for.html

***

Obama's wife crowd favorite in
campaign appearance with husband

CONWAY, New
Hampshire (AP) -- Illinois Sen. Barack Obama handed his jacket
to wife Michelle at one point during a steamy rally Sunday in a
school gym, but it was clear she's more than a coat-holder for
the Democratic presidential candidate.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/obamas-wife-crowd-favorite-in-campaign.html

***

For Democratic presidential
contenders, endorsements can mean delegates

NEW YORK (AP) -- It's more than half a year -- and a few
snowstorms -- until the first votes in Iowa, yet Democratic
presidential hopefuls have already captured some of the
delegates critical to winning the nomination.

Full
story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/for-democratic-presidential-contenders.html

* Democratic superdelegates who have endorsed New Mexico
Gov. Bill Richardson
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/democratic-super-delegates-who-have_2375.html

* Democratic superdelegates who have endorsed Sen. Barack
Obama, D-Illinois
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/democratic-super-delegates-who-have_1009.html

* Democratic superdelegates who have endorsed former Sen.
John Edwards, D-North Carolina
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/democratic-super-delegates-who-have_2520.html

* Democratic superdelegates who have endorsed Sen. Chris
Dodd, D-Connecticut
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/democratic-super-delegates-who-have_8083.html

* Democratic superdelegates who have endorsed Sen. Hillary
Rodham Clinton, D-New York
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/democratic-super-delegates-who-have_28.html

* Democratic superdelegates who have endorsed Sen. Joe
Biden, D-Delaware
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/democratic-super-delegates-who-have.html
